NATIONAL SCIENCE FOUNDATION

Attachment A: Financial System Implementation, Hosting, and Business Transaction Services

2

1.0 Introduction
The purpose of this Performance Work Statement (PWS) is to obtain services to support the National Science Foundation (NSF) in implementing a commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) Core Financial management system and interfaces in a hosted environment. NSF seeks to establish a contract that will provide a range of support for implementing and maintaining the financial management system under an initiative called iTRAK. This initiative will be conducted in compliance with all applicable Federal financial systems regulations and guidance. Specifically: Chief Financial Officer's Act of 1990 Clinger-Cohen Act (also known as the Information Technology Management Reform Act) FASAB SFFAS #6, A-136 Federal Manager's Financial Integrity Act of 1982 (FMFIA) Federal Financial Management Improvement Act of 1996 (FFMIA) Federal Information Security Management Act of 2002 Federal Acquisition Regulation, March 2005 Edition Financial Systems Integration Office (FSIO) core financial systems requirements; Governmentwide Accounting (GWA) Federal Accounting Standards Advisory Board Standards (FASAB) Federal Information Security Management Act of 2002 Freedom of Information Act amendments 5 USC 552 and 5 USC 552a Generally Accepted Accounting Principles Government Information Security Reform Act (Title X, Subtitle G of the Defense Authorization Act) Government Paperwork Elimination Act Government Performance and Results Act Government Management Reform Act Internal Revenue Code 6103 security constraints IRS Publication 1075 security constraints National Institute of Standards and technology (NIST) Special Publications (800 series) Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) 199 NIST Special Publication 800-53, Recommended Security Controls for Federal Information Systems OMB Circulars A-11, A-123, A-127, A-130, and A-134. OMB Guidance on Financial Systems Efforts OMB Memorandum M-10-26, Immediate Review of Financial Systems IT Projects OMB Memo 05-02, Financial Management Systems "OMB Competition Framework for Financial Management Line of Business Migrations," Financial Management Line of Business Migration Planning Guidance Paperwork Reduction Act Presidential Decision Directive PDD-63 Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act
3

Tax Increase Prevention and Reconciliation Act of 2005 Treasury's USSGL iTRAK is a joint effort between the Office of Budget, Finance and Administration (BFA) and the Office of Information Resources Management (OIRM). The BFA includes the Chief Financial Officer's office and the OIRM includes the Chief Information Officer's office.

2.0 Background
The NSF mission is "To promote the progress of science; to advance the national health, prosperity, and welfare; to secure the national defense." To fulfill this mission, NSF has an annual budget of over $6 billion and is the premier Federal agency supporting research across all fields of nonmedical science and engineering education. NSF funds more than 40 percent of the Federal support for nonmedical basic research at America's colleges and universities, and in 2008 alone, provided funding to 1,900 colleges, universities, and other institutions. With the creation of the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act (ARRA) in 2009, NSF's budget increased to $9 billion. In addition, since 1952, the Foundation has supported approximately 44,000 students through Graduate Research Fellowships and annually provides direct support to researchers, postdoctoral fellows, trainees, and teachers as well as students. Through its investment in people--their education and the research they conduct--NSF helps keep America at the leading edge of science, engineering, and technology.

3.0 Current Environment
Underlying the Foundation's investment in people are the financial management system and programs that enable funding for education and research initiatives to be received, allocated, and managed within budget and according to Federal laws and regulations. NSF's legacy financial management system, the Financial Accounting System (FAS), is the Division of Financial Management's (DFM) primary vehicle for managing funding allocated to the National Science Foundation. Central transaction management represents the core of the system, handling transaction processing, accounts maintenance, transaction history, and rules processing. The system includes extensive reporting capabilities to assist DFM and Administrative Officers in verifying funds throughout the fiscal year. The system support extensive editing for transactions input through the FAS as well as from other systems that interface with the FAS system. This system went into production in the client-server environment on April 23, 2001. Technical Description: The FAS was written and currently maintained using the following environments: Application Software: Database Engine: Database Server: C++, Sybase PowerBuilder V10.x with NSF PFC Framework Sybase SQL Server System 12.5.0.3 Sun E5500 Unix Server Running Solaris (Development) SunFire 6800 Unix Server/Solaris (Production) SunFire 6800 Unix Server/Solaris (User Acceptance) SunOS 5.8 Sybase Open Connect Windows 9X, Windows NT, Windows XP
4

Unix Operating System: Communication: Client Workstations:

Version Control: Special Features: Word Processing: Reporting: Batch Job Scheduling: IMB Rational Tools:

Rational ClearCase (UCM enabled) Multiple-Document-Interface (MDI) Application, GUI Front-End, TDClient Version V2.0 MS WORD, MS-RTF Custom Built Batch Infrastructure for Accounting System, MS Access 2000 and Excel for AD-HOC Reporting. BMC Control/M for client server ClearQuest, Test Manager, Robot

3.1 Limitations of As-Is Environment
FAS requires increasing time, effort, and funding to operate, maintain, and remain in compliance with Federal financial management regulations. While FAS has served the Foundation well for more than 20 years, the antiquated technology on which FAS is built makes continued compliance with Federal financial management requirements increasingly difficult and costly. It also severely limits NSF's ability to respond to emerging internal business needs and goals. More specifically, FAS poses the following performance gaps: Inadequate automated processing support and controls. The system has many manual processes, with a high potential for human error and duplication of effort. These manual processes increase both the level of effort to develop and test system change requests and the risk of reduced financial information integrity, effectiveness, and timeliness. This was an audit finding during the 2008 and 2009 financial statement audits. Lack of standard business processes and key functionality. As an in-house, legacy financial system, FAS has evolved based on immediate needs rather than strategic goals over the past two decades. FAS is expensive to operate and maintain, relies on outdated architecture and technologies, and offers very limited management and decision support functionality-- it does not meet NSF's mission requirements. Transparency. The Federal Funding Accountability and Transparency Act of 2006 (FFATA) established new award reporting requirements and procedures in an effort to increase the transparency of federally funded awards. In addition, the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 (ARRA) also created new, separate reporting requirements necessitating increased transparency, accuracy, and frequency of financial data. To meet FFATA and ARRA requirements, FAS requires difficult and costly modifications, which can be better met by a COTS financial shared services solution. Non-Compliance Risk. The system is at risk of not meeting Federal standards, such as OMB Circular A-127, FFMIA, FMFIA, and Treasury mandates. OMB Circular A-127. A-127 requires agencies to record financial events at the transaction level consistent with applicable definitions, attributes, and processing rules of the USSGL. FAS has a number of transaction codes non-compliant with the U.S. Standard General Ledger (USSGL) and established Treasury standards. Federal Core Financial System Requirements. A growing number of variances exist between current FAS functionality and Federal Core Financial systems requirements. Examples include the following:
5

FAS lacks the capability to produce Financial Statements. As a result, NSF must maintain statements in Excel spreadsheets, which requires extensive manual operations and data manipulation. FAS does not have the functionality to track the details of receivables. This information is stored and tracked in Excel spreadsheets, increasing the risk of miscalculations or human errors due to lack of automation and adequate controls. Costly Maintenance. FAS is at the end of its lifecycle, with a greater share of its maintenance budget spent on fixes rather than value-added enhancements. (In FY 2007, 95% of the FAS budget was spent on daily operations and preventive activities with only 5% of the budget focused on closing compliance gaps.)

4.0 Objectives and Goals
The objectives of the iTRAK solution are to provide robust functionality and financial information that will facilitate management decision making and create operating efficiencies in supporting NSF's mission. iTRAK will position NSF to provide accurate and reliable financial information to the Science Directorates and the grantee community without the substantial manual processes; address growing financial reporting requirements; maintain clean audit opinions; and provide continued financial management excellence to NSF. The objective of iTRAK is the successful implementation of a COTS Core Financial management system and key interfaces. Specific iTRAK goals are as follows: Goal I. Increase capabilities for more informed operational and programmatic decision-making. 1. Improve financial data accuracy and consistency. 2. Improve enterprise-level financial data access, transparency, and reporting. 3. Make timely and accurate financial data available for NSF Program Managers to track and monitor program progress. Goal II. Improve effectiveness and efficiency of financial and business processes. 1. Implement standard business processes and operating procedures. 2. Reduce manual processes. 3. Integrate data to reduce redundancy and reconciliation issues. Goal III. Enhance financial and business accountability, integrity, and compliance. 1. Automate controls and reconciliation points where appropriate 2. Improve traceability of transactions where appropriate 3. Provide for system flexibility and agility to meet current and future mandated Federal requirements.

6

5.0 General Requirements
iTRAK scope includes implementing a COTS Core Financial management system and key interfaces, hosted in a shared service environment. At a minimum, the items listed below shall be supplied and performed in accordance with the terms and conditions of the contract.The solution selected by NSF shall be able to demonstrate the following capabilities: Utilize a Core Financial management system that is compliant with Federal Financial System requirements; Comply with any additional applicable requirements, such as privacy, security, compliance with section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act, continuity of operations, critical infrastructure protection, disaster recovery, service level agreements, and help desk services; Comply with standards mandated by OMB and Treasury; Integrate with Standard Federal Interfaces (FedTraveler, Central Contractor Registration (CCR), Federal Procurement Data System - Next Generation (FPDS-NG); Comply with Shared Services Requirements - NSF desires to have the system hosted by a provider with operations and maintenance provided; Integrate to third-party software and NSF Mission Systems; Comply with NSF-specific requirements for the COTS shared services solution; Comply with NSF system and security requirements. NSF does not intend to customize the COTS financial management solution and instead will adopt business processes to realize the full benefits of the best practices and efficiencies built into the COTS software. NSF unique requirements will be addressed with configuration and not customization. Specific requirements are detailed in Attachment B: iTRAK Business Requirements and Attachment C: Interface Requirements.

6.0 Scope of Work
The Contractor shall implement a commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) Core Financial management system and key interfaces in a hosted environment. The items listed below shall be supplied and performed in accordance with the terms and conditions of the contract. The Contractor shall furnish the following: 1. Implementation services 2. Integration with NSF Systems 3. Integration with Federal Systems 4. Hosting services during integration and deployment 5. Project Management 6. Organizational Change Management & Training 7. Software Licenses (COTS Core Financial Management solution) 8. Transition Services 9. Hosting, Operations, and Maintenance 10. Business Process Support Services 11. Enhancement Services

7

The iTRAK project timeline calls for the implementation effort to begin April 1, 2012 and for the new financial system to achieve full operational capability in a hosted environment by October 1, 2013. NSF prefers to go-live at the beginning of the fiscal year. Full operational capability is defined as the iTRAK Core Financial system becoming NSF's financial system of record, with all Federal Financial System requirements and NSF specific requirements; all batch and online financial transactions, executed at the hosted location; including all NSF and Federal interface functionality. All reports shall be configured, working and accessible by users on October 1, 2013.

6.1. Implementation Services
The Contractor's proposed implementation approach and schedule shall demonstrate the interdependencies of all activities. The Contractor shall provide all necessary services for the successful implementation a COTS Core Financial management system that is compliant with Federal Financial System requirements and OMB Memo 10-26. The following implementation services objectives have been identified: System Configuration Data Migration and Conversion System Testing Develop Accounting Code Structure System Documentation Financial Reports System Deployment, Cutover and Release Management

6.2 Integration to NSF Systems
The Contractor shall provide all necessary services for the successful integration of the COTS Core Financial management system with NSF systems.

6.3 Integration to Federal Systems
The Contractor shall provide all necessary services for the successful integration the COTS Core Financial management system with Federal systems.

6.4 Hosting Services during implementation and integration
The Contractor shall provide hosting services during integration and deployment to support solution development, configuration, integration, data migration, testing, and staging. The hosting solution shall be in compliance with OMB guidelines and includes all services necessary to deliver the proposed approach from project initiation through system cut-over. The following hosting services objectives have been identified: Hardware and software Implementation environments (development, testing, training)

8

6.5 Software Licenses
The Contractor shall provide an enterprise COTS license solution, all warranties, terms and conditions. The estimated number of NSF users is 561. The Contractor shall include the methodology and pricing for adding licenses in the future if needed.

6.6 Project Management
The Contractor shall provide comprehensive and effective life cycle project management services and shall employ a management approach that is consistent with NSF's system development methodology, the Continuous Improvement Program (CIP) and project management best practices, notably those specified by the Project Management Institute (PMI). Details on CIP can be found in Attachment D: Division of Information Systems (DIS) Systems Development Lifecycle. The Contractor shall provide detailed information on the project management structure, resources and support methodology. The Contractor's project management support services, tools and processes shall include, but are not limited to: Schedule Management Scope Management Risk Management Project Financial Management Document Management Requirements Management Configuration Management Software Change Management Quality Control Cutover Management CIP Documentation Support Status Reporting

6.7 Organizational Change Management & Training
Organizational change management is a critical function in ensuring the acceptance and adoption of the new iTRAK financial system by NSF stakeholders. NSF requires transformation that aligns the business processes with the COTS solution. The Contractor shall be an active participant in the identification of transformational and organizational change issues (e.g., stakeholder transition, communications, and training) and in developing strategies for mitigating the impact and facilitating the adoption of new and reengineered business processes and supporting services. The Contractor's organizational change services, tools and processes shall include, but are not limited to:  Communications Organizational change Training

9

6.8 Hosting, Operations and Maintenance Services
Provide operations, maintenance and hosting services in a shared service environment. The items listed below shall be supplied and performed in accordance with the terms and conditions of the contract. The Contractor shall furnish the following: Hosting Services Operations and Maintenance Services The Contractor shall perform all hosting, operations and maintenance (O&M) activities for the new financial system including the security of the deployed system infrastructure. The Contractor shall be responsible staying up-to-date with current software versions. The Contractor shall be responsible for providing a change control process that enforces consistent configuration management across all increments, instances, and upgrades of the new financial system. The iTRAK project timeline calls for the new financial system to achieve full operational capability in a hosted environment by October 1, 2013. The Contractor shall perform all hosting, operations and maintenance (O&M) activities for the new financial system including the security of the deployed system infrastructure. The Contractor shall be responsible for providing a change control process that enforces consistent configuration management across all increments, instances, and upgrades of the new financial system.
6.8.1 Hosting Services for Production

Hosting Services involves providing the information technology (IT) infrastructure (facilities, infrastructure, hardware, and software) that serve as the foundation for running business software applications and the services to maintain that infrastructure. The Contractor shall provide all the necessary services to host the solution, consistent with the goals and objectives of this PWS. Hosting support includes but is not limited to the maintenance and operation of the hardware, data center support, software and telecommunications in support to the application. The following hosting objectives have been established: The Contractor shall provide all hardware, software, and infrastructure needed to host the proposed COTS solution. The Contractor shall provide a complete hosting solution in compliance with OMB Memo M-10-26, OMB Circular A-127, SSAE 16 requirements, all Federal Financial System and Security requirements, and NSF requirements and includes all services necessary to deliver the proposed approach for system cut-over and all post-deployment production operations. The Contractor shall provide the activities associated with transitioning into the production environment hosted by the SSP including facilities, hardware, software, data, and support transition. The Contractor shall provide hosting support includes but is not limited to maintenance and operation of the hardware, data center support and internet connection in support of the application. The Contractor shall ensure that a proper Continuity of Operations plan (COOP) and Disaster Recovery is in place. The Contractor shall establish and maintain application security and access controls.
10

The Contractors shall prepare and execute Service Level Agreement (SLA) that includes the performance indicators. Detailed technical and service level agreement requirements and metrics are in Attachment C: Interface Requirements, Attachment E: Service Level Agreement Technical Requirements and Attachment F: Hosting, Operations, and Maintenance Performance Metrics.
6.8.2 Operations and Maintenance Services

Operations and Maintenance Services involve providing the software and the services for running and managing the financial management software. The Core Financial solution shall consist of the use of Commercial-Off-The-Shelf (COTS) products with limited product extensions and limited customization of the core product. The Contractor shall be required to integrate operational components and configure the integrated solution to operate within the hosted environment. The foundation of the proposed solution must be compliant with Federal Financial System requirements. Application Management/Operations and Maintenance support includes but is not limited to functional and technical tasks directly related to the application which includes issue resolution, offline processing, any reference table updates, report maintenance in the software, monthly, quarterly and annual close processing, database dumps, and implementation and testing of new regulatory requirements. Software license maintenance costs and system upgrades are considered a part of hosting services. The following application management/operations and maintenance objectives have been established: The Contractor shall perform all operations and maintenance (O&M) activities for the new financial system including all application functional and technical support and security of the deployed solution including. The Contractor shall provide a process for software patching (changes to the software that are fixes and changes in a future software release that is needed prior to implementing the new release) and when major and minor software releases will be installed and the process for communicating the changes to the end users. The Contractor shall provide a change control process that includes customer input and enforces consistent configuration management across all increments, instances, and upgrades of the new financial system. The Contractor shall provide Tier 1, 2 and 3 help desk support. The Contractor shall prepare and execute Service Level Agreement (SLA) that includes the performance indicators outlined in the SLA requirements in Attachment E: Service Level Agreement Technical Requirements and Attachment F: Hosting, Operations, and Maintenance Performance Metrics.

6.9 Transition Services (Optional Task)
Transition services under this contract are critical to the Government and must continue without interruption. When the contract expires, a successor, either the Government or another contractor, may continue the services. The Contractor shall, apply its best efforts and cooperation to carry out an orderly and efficient transition to a successor. The contractor shall develop, document, and execute a transition plan that may be used to transition tasks and materials to a new SSP contractor or to the Government. The transition plan shall incorporate an inventory of
11

all deliverables under this contract. The plan shall include a schedule of briefings, including dates and time and resources allotted, that will be required to conduct a full transition. The plan is to ensure that the Government will be provided all of these deliverables and be fully briefed at least 90 days prior to the expiration date of the current task order or contract. Specific requirements will be addressed in a Task Order.

6.10 Enhancement Services (Optional Task)
After iTRAK implementation, NSF may decide to develop enhancements to the system based on user requests and business needs. This task is not for enhancements that are part of regular software maintenance that shall be included in 6.2 Hosting, Operations, and Maintenance Services. Application enhancements may be requested in response to changes in NSF business requirements. Enhancements might originate with user requests for specific capabilities or from management identification of solutions to substantive routine system problems. The Contractor shall document any enhancements following the agreed upon change control process, and follow the change control process to receive approval for the enhancement. The Contractor shall assist in designing, developing and implementing enhancements. Specific requirements will be addressed in a Task Order.

6.11 Business Process Support (Optional Task)
NSF is currently considering outsourcing transaction processing. The transactions that are currently under consideration are: Commercial payables/disbursements/reconciliation Travel payables/disbursements/reconciliation Draft Financial Statements (Quarterly and Yearly) Detailed transaction volume data is available in Attachment G: NSF Transactional Volume Data. Specific requirements will be addressed in a Task Order.

7.0 General Information
Performance based Task Orders will be issued against this contract as requirements are defined. Task Order procedures will be established in the IDIQ under the General Terms and Conditions section.

7.1. Data
   NSF will own transactional data, static data and NSF generated data NSF will receive functional and technical design specifications and all updates NSF will receive documentation of configuration and all updates

7.2 Key Personnel
The tables below contain a list of the key personnel and a description of the relevant experience. The Contractor may propose additional key personnel and non key personnel positions based on its past experience in the organization and execution of projects that are similar in size, scope and complexity. In such event, the Contractor shall include the rationale for this staffing approach in the Staffing Plan.
12

The IT Project Manager, Senior Business Analyst, and Senior Integration Analyst must have previous experience implementing the proposed Core Financial management system for a Federal government agency or component subject to the Chief Financial Officers Act or Accountability of Tax Dollars Act. Key Personnel NSF Labor Category IT Project Manager Position Description and Level of Experience B.S. or B.A. degree or equivalent experience; additional professional certifications preferred; Must have 13 years of IT experience, including at least 8 years of IT system management experience. Specialized Experience: At least 8 years of direct supervision of IT software development, integration, and maintenance projects. Must be capable of leading projects that involve the successful management of teams composed of data processing and other information management professionals who have been involved in analysis, design, integration, testing, documenting, converting, extending, and implementing automated information systems. B.S. or B.A. degree or equivalent experience with EVM experience preferred; Monitors financial and/or administrative aspects of assigned contracts and deliverables. Tracks and validates all client financial information, establishes and maintains master contract files, prepares and monitors status of all deliverables, tracks the value of contracts, and reports payment of government fees. Updates task reports with funding information and prepares revenue projections for all active contract task orders. Uses automated systems to track deliverables, financial transactions, and management information B.S. or B.A. degree or equivalent experience with Risk Management experience preferred; Monitors financial and/or administrative aspects of assigned contracts and deliverables. Tracks and validates all client financial information, establishes and maintains master contract files, prepares and monitors status of all deliverables, tracks the value of contracts, and reports payment of government fees. Updates task reports with funding information and prepares revenue projections for all active contract task orders. Uses automated systems to track deliverables, financial transactions, and management information

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |allow for extensions.                                 |
|TC-02-01            |The system must at least one (preferably multiple) online GUI that, at the agency’s discretion, can provide    |FSIO, TLC-01                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |consistent data entry, navigation, and information presentation across all modules and subsystems used in the  |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |online transaction processing environment to satisfy core financial system requirements.                       |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-02-02            |The system must comply with Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act provisions, as detailed in 36 CFR 1194,      |FSIO, TLC-02                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |Subpart B.                                                                                                     |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-02-03            |The system must provide a context-sensitive, online help facility that is customizable by the agency.          |FSIO, TLC-03                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-02-04            |The system must provide the capability to customize error message text.                                        |FSIO, TLC-04                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-02-05            |The system must provide automated functionality that increases system usability for end users, including user  |FSIO, TLC-05                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |interface features designed to reduce the amount of direct keying required for transaction processing. The     |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |following are examples of such functionality:                                                                  |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Default values based on system maintained transaction and user profiles                                      |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Value look-up tables                                                                                         |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Highlighting or accentuating of required fields                                                              |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Grayed data fields that are unavailable for user entry                                                       |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Auto tabs                                                                                                    |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Automatic data recall                                                                                        |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Auto-fill text                                                                                               |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Cut, copy, and paste                                                                                         |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Keyboard shortcuts (function keys to invoke help facility, clear screen, etc.)                               |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Menu mode of screen navigation                                                                               |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Undo/redo                                                                                                    |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Disabling of unsupported function keys                                                                       |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Ability to select records from a list by scrolling or typing only part of an entry                           |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Ability to pass common data from field to field, screen to screen, and transaction to transaction.           |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-02-06                                                                                                                                                                                                                |The system must provide the capability to customize   |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |warning messages.                                     |
|TC-03-01            |The system must provide automated functionality that imports and processes standard transactions generated by  |FSIO, TLD-01                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |other systems.                                                                                                 |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-03-02            |The system must process interfaced transactions applying the same business rules, program logic, and validity  |FSIO, TLD-03                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |checks used by the system in processing transactions submitted through a GUI.                                  |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-03-03            |The system must deliver the capability to suspend erroneous API transactions. Suspense processing must include |FSIO, TLD-04                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |the ability to perform the following functions:                                                                |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Report suspended transactions                                                                                |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Retrieve, view, correct and process, roll back transactions,or cancel suspended transactions                 |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Automatically reprocess transactions                                                                         |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Report reprocessed transactions.                                                                             |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-03-06            |The system must provide the automated capability to connect to a SMTP-compliant email system. This capability  |FSIO, TLD-07                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |must include the ability to distribute application-generated text messages with attached files.                |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-03-07            |The system must provide the automated capability, when needed, to allow those records in a batch processed     |FSIO, TLD-11                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |interface file that pass validity checks to be processed even though some records in the same batch failed the |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |validity checks.                                                                                               |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-03-08            |The system must provide the capability to determine interface import statuses like success, pending (for       |FSIO, TLD-12                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |routing to others for further analysis), or reject.                                                            |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-03-09                                                                                                                                                                                                                |The system must accommodate open standards, including |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |web services (e.g., Changes on the back end of iTRAK  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |database will cause minimal or no disruption to       |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |interfaces).                                          |
|TC-04-01            |The system must deliver an integrated workflow management capability to automate internal routing of documents,|FSIO, TLE-01                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |transactions, forms, or reports for online approval processing.                                                |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-04-02            |The system must provide the capability to customize workflow processes to automate agency-defined business     |FSIO, TLE-02                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |rules, required approvers, pooled or proxy approving authorities, and workload balancing. Agency customization |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |must include the capability to apply start and end dates to approvers and their proxies.                       |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-04-03            |The system must provide the capability to define multiple levels of document approvals based on agency-defined |FSIO, TLE-03                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |criteria, including dollar amounts, types of items purchased, and document types.                              |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-04-04            |The system must enable a single user to establish and maintain multiple approval levels and must prevent a user|FSIO, TLE-04                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |from applying more than one level of approval to the same document in order to conform to the principle of     |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |separation of duties. For example, a disbursing officer must not be allowed to certify payment of a payment    |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |request he/she entered, and a certifying officer must not be allowed to schedule a payment he/she certified.   |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-04-05            |The system must deliver a workflow calendaring capability to generate date-based process exception reports and |FSIO, TLE-05                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |alerts. For example, the system must notify an accounts payable office when payment requests are held over 30  |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |days with no matching receiving report.                                                                        |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-04-06            |The system must provide the capability to capture approval actions by transaction, including the system        |FSIO, TLE-06                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |identifier (source) time and date and the user ID of the approving official.                                   |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-04-08            |The system must provide the capability to generate workflow event-based user alerts. For example, it must      |FSIO, TLE-08                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |notify a traveler when an emergency travel voucher is approved.                                                |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-04-09            |The system must deliver automated functionality that generates user alerts based on agency-defined thresholds  |FSIO, TLE-09                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |(trigger events) (for example, notify a budget officer when available funds reach 50% of the allotment).       |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-04-10                                                                                                                                                                                                                |Workflow decisions in iTRAK must be able to initiate  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |workflow based on industry-standards, including BPEL  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |and BPM.                                              |
|TC-05-01            |The system must provide the capability to index and store file reference materials received or generated by the|FSIO, TLF-01                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |agency in electronic format.                                                                                   |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-05-02            |The system must provide the capability to electronically image, index, and store file reference materials      |FSIO, TLF-02                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |delivered in a hard-copy format (e.g., a signed contract, bill of lading, or vendor payment request).          |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-06: Internet Access                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                      |
|TC-06-01            |The delivered system must support the industry leading standard for application component connectivity (e.g. - |FSIO, TLG-01                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |TCP/IP, TLS-SSL, HTTPS)                                                                                        |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-06-04            |The system must support secure Internet access to the integrated ad hoc data query facility.                   |FSIO, TLG-04                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-07: Security                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                                      |
|TC-07-01            |The system must deliver integrated security functionality compliant with the current NIST security standards.  |FSIO, TLH-01                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-07-02            |The system must ensure that the management, operations, and technical baseline security controls are           |FSIO, TLH-02                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |implemented in accordance with current FIPS 200 Minimum Security Requirements for Federal Information and      |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |Information System, NIST 800-53 Rev 3, Recommended Security Controls for Federal Information Systems and       |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |Organizations, and other current NIST guidance on selecting the appropriate security controls. The target FISMA|                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |security baseline level is Moderate.                                                                           |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-07-04            |The system must consistently enforce the appropriate security controls in all modules, including software used |FSIO, TLH-04                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |for ad hoc data query and report generators.                                                                   |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-07-05            |The system must provide the capability to restrict access to sensitive data elements, such as social security  |FSIO, TLH-05                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |numbers, banking information by user ID, assigned role, and organization.                                      |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-07-06                                                                                                                                                                                                                |The system must provide the capability to log user IDs|
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |of those users who access sensitive data.             |
|TC-08-01            |The system must deliver a process scheduling capability that allows the agency to define, initiate, monitor,   |FSIO, TLI-01                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |and stop system processes (e.g., online availability, batch jobs, and system maintenance).                     |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-08-02            |The system must maintain internal database consistency at all times. In the event of a system failure, the     |FSIO, TLI-02                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |system must have the capability to do the following:• Back out incompletely processed transactions• Restore the|                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |system to its last consistent state before the failure occurred• Reapply all incomplete transactions previously|                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |submitted by the user• Validate internal database consistency to ensure that duplicate postings are avoided•   |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |Report any data or transactions that failed to process completely.                                             |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-08-03            |The system must generate online status messages to the operator that indicate the job or transaction type,     |FSIO, TLI-03                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |name, time processing initiates, time processing is completed, and any processing errors encountered.          |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-08-04            |The system must deliver a restart capability for all application online and batch-processing components. Batch |FSIO, TLI-04                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |jobs must be segmented to facilitate restart in the event of a system failure.                                 |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-08-05            |The system must deliver common error-handling routines across functional modules, and it must generate         |FSIO, TLI-05                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |meaningful/customizable, traceable error messages that allow the user or system operator to identify and       |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |respond to reported problems.                                                                                  |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-08-06            |The system must provide a document archiving capability, including the ability to define, establish, and       |FSIO, TLI-06                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |maintain archival criteria such as date, accounting period, closed items, and vendors/customers inactive for a |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |specific time period. Archiving of closed or completed detail transactions must not affect related general     |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |ledger account balances.                                                                                       |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-08-07            |The system must support data archiving and record retention in accordance with NSF policy which are in         |FSIO, TLI-07                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |accordance with rules published by NARA, GAO, and NIST. For NSF Specific policy, see their website:            |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |http://www.nsf.gov/policies/records/index.jsp                                                                  |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-08-08            |The system must provide the capability to restore archived data based on agency-defined criteria such as date, |FSIO, TLI-08                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |accounting period, or vendor/customer.                                                                         |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-08-09            |The system must deliver an event logging capability for systems, transactions, tables, and system parameters.  |FSIO, TLI-09                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |The logs must include the following:                                                                           |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• User ID                                                                                                      |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• System date and time                                                                                         |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Type of activity (addition, modification, deletion)                                                          |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Old value                                                                                                    |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• New value.                                                                                                   |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |For example, the system must provide a log of all attempts to log on to the system or a log of changes made to |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |the interest values in a prompt payment interest rate table.                                                   |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-08-10            |The system must provide the automated capability to maintain and report application usage statistics.          |FSIO, TLI-10                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |Productivity statistics should include concurrent users, job submissions, transactions throughput, and system  |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |availability.                                                                                                  |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-08-11            |The system must provide the capability to simulate different dates to support testing over multiple periods.   |FSIO, TLI-11                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-08-12            |The system must provide the capability to process queued jobs (reports, transaction files from interfacing     |FSIO, TLI-12                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |systems, bulk record updates) with no online performance degradation.                                          |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-08-13            |The system must provide the capability to customize system logging features. The system must allow the agency  |FSIO, TLI-13                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |to specify which parameters (or tables) to log and must allow the agency to turn logging feature on or off as  |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |needed.                                                                                                        |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-08-14            |The system must provide capability to alert NSF operations of failed processes.                                |NSF Requirement             |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-08-15            |The system must provide the capability to export official records as required by NSF.                          |NSF Requirement             |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-09: Ad-Hoc Query                                                                                                                                                                                                     |                                                      |
|TC-09-01            |The system must deliver an integrated ad hoc query capability to support agency access to and analysis of      |FSIO, TLJ-01                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |system-maintained financial data.                                                                              |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-09-02            |The system must provide the capability to define parameter-based query scripts that can be queued for          |FSIO, TLJ-02                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |execution, stored for reuse, and shared with other authorized agency users.                                    |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-09-03            |The system must process submitted queries and queue output online for access by authorized users.              |FSIO, TLJ-03                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-09-04            |The system must route query results to designated individuals or groups of individuals or notify individuals   |FSIO, TLJ-04                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |that query results are available online.                                                                       |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-09-05            |The system must deliver run-time controls to prevent “run-away” queries and to restrict very large data        |FSIO, TLJ-05                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |download requests.                                                                                             |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-09-06            |The system must provide the capability to display graphical output on the desktop with dynamic report          |FSIO, TLJ-06                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |reformatting.                                                                                                  |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-09-07            |The system must deliver an online drill-down capability from summary amounts in queries to supporting detail   |FSIO, TLJ-07                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |records.                                                                                                       |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-09-08            |The system must provide the capability to download selected query data and to reformat downloaded query        |FSIO, TLJ-08                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |information for direct access by common desktop applications (spreadsheet, ASCII text, comma-delimited text,   |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |etc.).                                                                                                         |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-09-09            |The system must provide the capability to preview a query, form, report, or other result before printing.      |FSIO, TLJ-09                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-09-10            |The system must provide the capability to access current-year and historical financial data.                   |FSIO, TLJ-10                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-09-11            |The system must deliver the following ad hoc query interface features:                                         |FSIO, TLJ-11                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Graphical display of data sources                                                                            |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Ability to point and click on table, data, and link objects for inclusion in a custom query                  |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Access to object definitions through a data dictionary.                                                      |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-09-12            |The system must provide the ability to obtain a comprehensive data extract for free form query manipulation.   |NSF Requirement             |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-09-13            |The system must provide the capability to print a query, form, report, or other result.                        |NSF Requirement             |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-10: Documentation                                                                                                                                                                                                    |                                                      |
|TC-10-01            |The system must be delivered with documentation that identifies all software and hardware products needed by an|FSIO, TLK-01                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |agency to install, operate, access, and maintain the application. The documentation must specifically identify |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |those products that are intended to be purchased or licensed as part of the product licensing agreement and    |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |those products needed to meet any technical and functional requirement that must be acquired separately by the |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |agency.                                                                                                        |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-10-02            |The system must have application design documentation and provide the capability to be delivered within 30 days|FSIO, TLK-02                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |upon request by NSF . This documentation must include the following:                                           |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Description of the application’s design/architecture and integrated technologies                             |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Database specifications                                                                                      |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Data dictionary                                                                                              |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Entity relationship diagrams                                                                                 |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Internal file record layouts                                                                                 |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Cross references between internal files, database tables, and data-entry screens                             |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• Program module specifications, including firmware and program source code                                    |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |• System flowcharts.                                                                                           |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |Application documentation must identify known problems (software bugs) and recommended work-arounds.           |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-10-03            |The system must be delivered with product installation and maintenance documentation and provide capability to |FSIO, TLK-03                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |be delivered within 30 days as per request by NSF. Installation documentation must describe the following      |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |items:• Product release content• Third-party software configuration requirements• Database installation steps• |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |Directory structure for locating application data, programs, files, and tables, including drive mappings•      |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |Hardware driver installation and configuration• Application security setup and maintenance• Software           |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |configuration instructions• Operating parameter definitions and any other required setup data• Software build  |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |instructions• Vendor-supplied configuration tools• Interface processes to be installed• Startup scripts needed |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |to initiate the software• Test steps needed to verify correct installation.                                    |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
|TC-10-04            |The system must be delivered with system operations and user manuals. Documentation must explain the following |FSIO, TLK-04                |M                  |                                  |                                                      |
|                    |system operations:                                                                                             |                            |                   |                                  |                                                      |
